title: Update `xvc pipeline dag` to create more complex Graphviz diagrams
body:
This updates `xvc pipeline dag`  dot output to create diagrams that show different types of dependencies with different node shapes. 

It also simplifies how diagrams are created.

title: Update deps
body:
- updated dependencies
- cargo fix
- minor fixes
- added some missing docs

title: Add Generic command, URL, RegexItems, GlobItems, LineItems as dependency types and convert XvcPipelines to run multithreaded
Add examples to S3-compatible storage reference pages
113 xvc file untrack and xvc file remove
203-rename-cache-type-to-recheck-method-in-all-the-code-and-documentation
body: Rename the struct and related code

title: Add Giscus to the book
body: Add giscus discussions to all Xvc book pages

title: Add `xvc file move`
body:
- Adds `xvc file move` command and fixes some bugs in `xvc file copy``
- Refactors `file::copy` module to reuse code in move

title: 185-if-store-or-ec-didnt-change-it-shouldnt-record-any-files
body:
Fixes #185

Add a dirty bit to struct to identify whether it has changed or not on save.

title: Convert XvcEntity to (u64, u64) to fix branch related possible problems
body:
The first part of the tuple is the same as previous, while the second `u64` is generated randomly for each command invocation. This makes entities unique and also sorted. 


Close #89
Close #88

title: Adds `xvc file carry-in` (commit) command
body:
This is one of the largest PRs I've ever written in the project.

- Adds `xvc file carry-in` command. 
- Adds a `Diff<T>` type to `xvc-core::types`and refactors all path related comparisons with it. 
- Adds a `DiffStore<T>` type to represent diffs of any `Storable` entity
- `HStore` now has `from_storable` function to create from `XvcStore`
- `R1NStore::children_of` now returns `HStore` instead of `XvcStore`. This affects all crates that use this function. 
- `XvcStore::filter` and `XvcStore::subset` now returns an `HStore` instead of `Self`, not to create an event log when a subset is created.
- Adds `targets_from_disk` and `targets_from_store` functions to `xvc-file::common` to get individual targets from command parameters. This unifies almost all target receiving commands behavior. Targets in commands are now strings instead of PathBuf objects and they are expanded as globs. 
- `xvc-file::common::PathComparisonParams` is removed. Instead a set of functions that return `Diff` structs are written. All commands in xvc file are affected from this rewrite. 
- Added `error!`, `warn!`, ..., macros to `xvc-logging` that may call corresponding `log` macros or sends the message to a `Sender<XvcOutputLine>` channel. This simplifies to use a separate output thread in all of the project. 
- `xvc file list` now uses a format string for columns. It's parsed and `{{name}}` like columns are replaced with the name of file, etc. 
- Removes `--text-or-binary` option from `xvc file recheck`. Rechecking doesn't update the file, we only use this distinction when we calculate the hash. 
- `xvc` binary now has a `--debug` option to determine whether to write trace output to `xvc.log`
- `XvcCLI` now has a `from_args_os` function to parse the cli with clap and update command string field
- Output channels are passed by reference to all `cmd` functions
- Cache is now read only for all files. 
- `xvc file bring` now uses a temp directory to download and moves to cache afterwards. This is use a single function (`move_to_cache`) for all cache related files. 
- `xvc-test-helper` is now an executable to perform various test related fixture operations. It can create random files etc. to test the documentation examples. 
- `xvc-walker` now has a `make_polling_watcher` command to use when `make_watcher` behaves strangely. 
- All tests in the workflow tests and the documentation are updated with these changes. 
- Makes documentation tests to run only on macOS. Otherwise it takes too much time to fix the CI for irrelevant brittle information. (`tree` behavior and symbolic link size changes between OSes, for example.)

Closes #197 as its intention is covered with `--format` parameter here. 

Closes #194
